protocol.title: Model Context Protocol
protocol.description: MCP (Model Context Protocol) is an open protocol developed by Anthropic that allows AI models to safely access external tools and data sources.

dataConnection.label: Data Connection

integration.label: Easy Integration

skills.title: Skills
skills.importHint: Click + button to import Skill file or folder
skills.deleteMessage:
Are you sure you want to delete {{scope}} Skill "{{name}}"?

This action cannot be undone.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Skills are dynamically loaded instruction sets, scripts, and resource folders that enhance Claude's performance for specific tasks. Skills teach Claude how to complete particular tasks in a repeatable way, such as creating documents using company brand guidelines, analyzing data following organization-specific workflows, or automating personal tasks.

structure.title: Skill Structure
structure.description: A Skill is a folder containing a SKILL.md file:
structure.example:
my-skill/
├── SKILL.md          # Required: skill definition file
├── templates/        # Optional: template files
└── references/       # Optional: reference materials

format.title: SKILL.md Format
format.description: SKILL.md files use YAML frontmatter + Markdown format:
format.example:
---
name: my-skill-name
description: Skill description and when to use
---

# Skill Instructions

Detailed instruction content...
format.hint: name and description are required fields. Optional fields include license, allowed-tools, metadata

tips.title: Usage Tips
tips.item1: Ensure Skill directory contains a valid SKILL.md file
tips.item2: Skill names must use lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (hyphen-case)
tips.item3: Skills automatically take effect in Claude sessions after loading
tips.item4: Control individual Skill status with enable/disable toggles
tips.item5: Mention Skill name in chat to use it, e.g., "Use the pdf skill to extract form fields"

opus45.label: Opus 4.5
opus45.description: Opus 4.5 · Most capable for complex work

gpt51codexMax.label: gpt-5.1-codex-max
gpt51codexMax.description: Codex-optimized flagship for deep and fast reasoning.

gpt51codexMini.label: gpt-5.1-codex-mini
gpt51codexMini.description: Optimized for codex. Cheaper, faster, but less capable.

gpt52.label: gpt-5.2
gpt52.description: Latest frontier model with improvements across knowledge.

default.label: Default Mode
default.description: Requires manual confirmation for each operation, suitable for cautious use

plan.label: Plan Mode
plan.tooltip: Plan mode - No execution (not supported yet)
plan.description: Planning only without execution, not supported yet

acceptEdits.label: Agent Mode
acceptEdits.description: Automatically accept file creation/editing, reducing confirmation steps

bypassPermissions.label: Auto Mode
bypassPermissions.description: Fully automated, bypassing all permission checks [Use with caution]

default.label: Suggest (approval)
default.tooltip: Codex approval_policy=untrusted – prompts before editing files or running shell commands.
default.description: Safest option. Every write or command requires your approval.

acceptEdits.label: Auto Edit
acceptEdits.tooltip: Codex approval_policy=auto-edit – automatically applies file patches, still asks before shell commands.
acceptEdits.description: Auto-create and edit files via apply_patch while keeping command approvals.

bypassPermissions.label: Full Auto
bypassPermissions.tooltip: Codex approval_policy=never – runs commands and writes files without prompting (workspace sandbox still enforced).
bypassPermissions.description: Hands-off mode. Codex executes edits and shell commands immediately.

promptEnhancer.title: Prompt Enhancer
promptEnhancer.tooltip: Rewrite prompt to provide more context and improve agent responses
